instruction: Tell me a story with a moral
output: Once upon a time there was a man who lived a life of luxury. He had all the money he could ever want, but he was never satisfied; he was always looking for more. One day, he decided to leave his lavish home and journey through the countryside to find true happiness. As he traveled, he encountered a wise old man who told him, “True happiness can’t be found in material possessions, it is found within yourself.” The moral of the story is that true happiness comes from within, not from external sources.
